sentence.text: Coming to the Elbow , where the runners veer right-handed off the main course towards the line with little more than a furlong to go , Pitman gave his mount a smack down the right-hand side .
He veered left towards them and put his own jacket on the ground .
We walked across to the teenagers ' car , which had veered across the lawn of a local church .
` He veered across the road and went into the opposite lane where he collided with a transit van . "
The voice had veered from exasperation to incredulity .
She was about to veer in a different direction when she felt an arm like steel round her waist .
The car veered into the outside lane .
Behind them , the Peugeot veered into view , skidding slightly on the wet road .
There was a story about an oil tanker that had veered off course and steamed right through Heaven Sound .
A tractor and trailer was being driven across the bridge , when a wheel came off the tractor and it veered through the stone parapet .
I stayed in the darkness vomiting as the ship veered wildly through the troughs of high waves .

He continually veered close to grand statements , then pulled back .
The key is to keep the fish just warm to avoid over-heating , and to veer towards a too solid rather than too oily mixture .
The stallion veered away and kicked out in an enormous arc .

( He resumes pacing , then , spinning on his heels to avoid the wall , he veers round , stares you straight in the face , hands flared , fingers spread frozen in time and space , chin tucked in on itself like a gossiping neighbour , takes another deep breath through the nose , opens his mouth , swivels his eyes to left and right and walks clean out of the room .
For a while she listened , trying to find out more about her new owner , but the conversation veered back to the voyage .
While Hazel gazed , the wind slowly veered round into the west , as Cowslip had said it would , and brought the rain driving into the mouth of the hole .
